reviews.sentence: Dogcation. My husband and myself took a vacation recently with our dog Magneto. Our overall experience at this hotel was was positive. For starters the hotel is pet friendly. They provided two bowls too small for our dog along with a blanket. The staff was very friendly towards us and Magneto. One night after taking Mags out we stayed in the lobby talking to the employees and they also gave him some treats. There is a spot of grass across the street where you can take your pet. The hotel is also located in an convenient area walking distance from a lot of restaurants and stores. One of the main drawbacks to this hotel is that they do not have refrigerators in the rooms. Because we also had wet food for Magneto we had to continue to get ice to refill our ice chest. The hotel stated they did have refrigerators at one point but they were removed.

Yes but keep in mind. When you find a room here at the trip advisor price of 140 it is definitely a great choice. Newly renovated location is fun Gaslamp is where you wana stay. service is good they think of everything. nice atmosphere. BUT when you are charged 400 for a 150 room you should be very upset. And we even got a twin and not king. As for noise at first we did get a room with a connecting door which was horrible noisy like hell like it was a thin paper and not a door. Strangely a large group of women were shouting and laughing endlessly. Luckily they moved us to a quiet room where we only heard a couple having sex that is ok with me. Also if you want a quiet room ask for the back side and not street side. Parking is 28.

Hotel Lacks the Small Things. The Bristol Hotel is a nice hotel in the center of San Diego. The service staff I thought was outstanding. The valet parking was a little cumbersome but if you call ahead your car will be waiting by the time you arrive in the valet area. The bell hop was polite and efficient. On the negative side the bed was hard and the bed coverings were insufficient for a chilly night. Fortunately for me I had a double so I was able to strip one bed to double up on the bed coverings. The television although a flat screen was subpar it did not have high definition and reception was bad. No visible electrical outlets to charge your devices. No vending machines.

What a Fun Place. What a great hotel. it is in a safe part of town newly decorated with a restaurant and lounge and within walking distance of Little Italy or Gaslamp or within a block of bus and trolley lines. The Bristol Hotel on First has a trolley line right around the corner a bus line to PETCO on the other side on Broadway and is within a five block walk to Little Italy on the south. The staff must have been trained in nice school because the car valet receptionist and even the maids greet you and are quick to help. I kept leaving things in my SUV that would have elicited eye rolling from most valets but not these guys. The room has the cool look you would expect from a boutique hotel and is surprisingly large. The lounge downstairs and the room service have good menus and are very reasonable in cost. The only downside was room 306 and the other rooms that are on that side of the hotel are a little too close to the trolley line. We were awakened by the trolleys warning honks every 15 minutes. Maybe that is why they provide ear plugs in that room. We still were able to sleep in until 8 so we can not complain but I had advise getting a room near the elevators. Parking is 26 which is normal for the area although you can get better deals at the public lots surrounding the hotel. We really liked this hotel for where it is the vibe of the staff and it is cool looking. large rooms at a reasonable price. we will go back.

Awesome Stay. but a little noisy can not beat the location literaly in the heart of Downtown San Diego everything was walking distance. The Staff was friendly we were greeted with open arms and never hesitated to ask you if you needed any assistance. Our room was nice and clean only draw back was that there were a lot of construction going on in the area and would have to wake up to the sound of a jackhammer going off. however you get complimentary ear plugs on your night stands for this. Other than that our stay was great. We will definitely come back again.

Hotel had a lot of room. Comfortable bed. Neighbors were a little loud and the walls were a little thin I booked a deluxe room but got a room with a view of the wall of the next building over. This was our first getaway together. paying the extra 20 30 dollars on a deluxe room was not worth it. But the overall stay and staff were welcoming and kind. The Parking though is 26 a day. So I would suggest they advertise that part. How else would I get there without expecting to drive my car and an expected free parking.

Overall the hotel is nice great location and well priced. Outside looked old but the inside is nicely remodeled. New finishes except the shower head was old. When we checked in the shower was not completely clean but they came right away and we are very apologetic. Since the cleaning service was so nice and prompt that was not a big deal. I think the biggest complaint was how long valet service took to get our car. Everyone was waiting at least 10 minutes for their car to arrive. I would suggest calling downstairs first to bring your car around.
Clean but no frills. Nice hotel with helpful staff. Would like room a bit bigger with a small refrigerator. Would be nice to offer a light breakfast fruit and muffins in the mornings.

Bad hotel. Will not be returning there. I liked the location however the city was doing road construction outside the front of the hotel. Most restaurants were within walking distance. Our first room was above the construction and the key did not work. In the second room the hot water in the shower was almost non existent and the trickle showerhead was ridiculous. To wash my hair I had to get so close the shower control poked me on the rear end. I rolled to the center of the bed and the thermostat did not work so we called downstairs. They sent someone to look at and he set the temp to 55 degrees so we asked for extra blankets which never arrived.

The Bristol Hotel. We stayed at the Bristol for 4 days in one of the newly renovated rooms. They were nicely done with good colors. The shower was very nice. The room was quiet for sleeping. The hotel is located in an ideal spot for downtown tourists within walking distance of the waterfront Little Italy and the Gaslamp District. The bar was nice but very quiet.

Really enjoyed our sta. Everyone that I came in contact with was very friendly. The room was very nice clean and quiet. The bed was very comfortable. My only request would have been to have On Demand movies in the room. That happens to be a guilty pleasure of mine when I stay in hotels. Otherwise everything was great.

The location was very good and we appreciated that the hotel was close to shopping grocery stores the Gaslamp quarter and the I5 freeway. Our room on the 8th floor was clean and comfortable with a sweet little partial ocean view. The 39 per night valet parking fee the only parking option is definitely something to consider when you look at the nightly rate. One night we came home late from a tour and asked the front desk for a list of recommended restaurants that deliver nearby we were told to use the device in our room which did not work and was taken by an engineer and never returned during our stay. There was definitely some partying going on in the hotel that weekend thankfully not on our floor. There is some street noise that can be heard through the windows sirens trolley horns and ear plugs were provided. Overall we would stay here again if we wanted to be downtown.

Good location good value. Clean smartly furnished nice value. Decent continental breakfast Traveled on business could walk to convention center and good restaurants stores etc. Lack of drawers no problem for me plenty of shelf space under huge TV and other places to put stuff. Also not as noisy as other Gaslamp locations I grabbed a room on a high floor in the back very quiet.
Exceptional. Rooms were great staff was wonderful front the front desk to the bar tender.

Wonderful. The hotel is absolutely beautiful with well appointed rooms and tablets for communicating with the front desk regarding any issues. The bed was amazingly comfortable and made us immediately decide to replace our mattress at home as soon as possible. The front desk staff member when I checked in was so sweet and she was very helpful when my husband and my anniversary overnight turned into a need for another room for my parents and kids due to train delays. We had a fabulous time and plan to stay at the Bristol when we return to San Diego.
noisy. beds nice tv although without Netflix or other entertainment option. Room extremely noisy. no sound insulation at all.

Loved it. Location. Clean Cute. Loved it. Booked a last minute girls trip we were so pleased. Loved the location the super cute rooms. The rooms lobby were really clean excellent service really kind staff we asked for late check out they were so happy to accommodate us close to everything cool in SD and breakfast was nice.

It was enjoyable once we finally got our room. Good room and breakfast. Location was good. Room was not prepared at the time promised. Staff told us to sit and wait in the lobby until they called us. Then they must have had a change in shift and the new staff did not know we were waiting.
Wonderful. Lovely spacious rooms good location free coffee and water a nice touch. Breakfast included would have made it better value for money but it was a good stay.

From the minute I walked in I was impressed. I ’ve stayed at a lot of “ downtown area ” hotels that frankly left me scared and departing for another hotel—this one is beyond a five star and is within walking distance of the convention we ’re attending at the Mariot marquis double win. The lobby is open and welcoming the front desk staff Chase was personable accommodating and took care of every need efficiently and with a smile. He informed us about local places to eat within walking distance told us about their hotel breakfasts water refill station and made the whole check in process simple and speedy. The decor is modern and unique there is a candy jar in your room robes the most comfortable bed imaginable and the hotel itself offers a gym business center and more. Just all those little extra touches that make you feel like a special guest — and make you want to come back again and again.
